data.description: Economic problems of individuals, firms and industries with emphasis on value, price, and distribution of income.
data.title: PRINCIPLES OF MICROECONOMICS

data.description: Integrated treatment of macroeconomics and microeconomics (seeECON 101andECON 102). Accelerated approach to economics training, especially for Economics: Math Emphasis majors.
data.title: PRINCIPLES OF ECONOMICS-ACCELERATED TREATMENT

data.description: Macroeconomic measurement and models of aggregate demand and supply; fiscal and monetary policy for unemployment, inflation, and growth.
data.title: PRINCIPLES OF MACROECONOMICS

data.description: Social and economic determinants and consequences of contemporary and historical population trends in both developed and developing societies. Fertility, mortality, migration, population distribution, age structure, population growth.
data.title: POPULATION AND SOCIETY

data.description: Social, economic, and political problems affected by birth and death rates, population size and distribution, voluntary and forced migration. World ecology, limits to growth, economic development, international conflict, environmental quality, metropolitan expansion, segregation by age, race, and wealth. Policies affecting reproduction, nuptiality, morbidity, mortality, migration.
data.title: POPULATION PROBLEMS
